meanings.definition: A person who has converted from one opinion, religion, or party to another.
meanings.sent1: The new member of the club was a proselyte who used to belong to a different group.
meanings.sent2: The proselytes at the temple were warmly welcomed by the community.
meanings.sent3: The proselyte accidentally wore the wrong team's jersey to the game, causing some confusion.
meanings.sent4: She was a proselyte to the world of fashion, embracing new trends with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The proselyte's journey from skepticism to belief was truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: To convert or attempt to convert someone from one opinion, religion, or party to another.
meanings.sent1: The missionaries tried to proselyte the villagers to their faith.
meanings.sent2: She decided to proselyte her friend to join her in volunteering at the shelter.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly attempted to proselyte his cat into becoming a dog, but the cat remained unimpressed.
meanings.sent4: The marketing team worked hard to proselyte customers to switch to their new product.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech aimed to proselyte voters to support his campaign.
